name: Yr Afon
description: Forest road loop contouring the hill with waterfall views. Perfect for novices and families. Control speed on descents.

name: MinorTaur
description: Perfect intro to mountain biking. Reasonably flat and wide (1.5m minimum). Four loops (3/5/9/12km). Fun berms and bumps, no major climbs. Great for kids but enjoyable for experienced riders too.

name: Cyflym Coch
description: Easiest red at Coed y Brenin. Increases in challenge as it progresses. Includes Dreamtime and Uncle Fester sections. Great for progressing from blue.

name: Temtiwr
description: Short but punchy. Red grade with black TTFs. Undulating traverse then fire road climb, finishing on fast trio: Beginning of the End, Glide, and Seven Sisters. Rocky and demanding.

name: Tarw Du
description: Coed y Brenin's oldest trail featuring iconic Y Slab rock sections. Rocky, retro, twisty and technical. Classic descents and old favourites throughout.

name: MBR
description: Packs highlights from Dragon's Back and Beast into 18km. Features modernised Able with rocky fly-offs and updated False Teeth. Maximum quality in minimum distance.

name: Dragon's Back
description: Longest red at Coed y Brenin. Classic technical XC with tough climbs and long fast descents. Highlight: top-to-bottom Addams Family descents (Gomez, Morticia, Pugsley, Lurch, Uncle Fester).

name: The Beast
description: Coed y Brenin's biggest challenge. Everything: fast open sections, tight technical bits, flowing singletrack, bone-shaking rocks. Major MTB milestone. Not for the faint-hearted.

name: Kermit
description: UK's best beginner downhill trail. 4.2km of flowing green perfection. Utterly unique introduction to gravity riding. Part of Ticket to Ride experiences.

name: Terry's Belly
description: Flowing blue with optional features. Perfect progression from Kermit. Berms, rollers, and baby jumps you can roll if nervous.

name: Dai Hard
description: Classic red flow trail. Well-built jumps, berms, and drops. Good intro to reds at BPW.

name: Vicious Valley
description: Natural feeling red with roots and rocks. Tests technique more than the machine-built trails.

name: A470
description: Serious jump trail. Gaps, step-downs, and committed features. For experienced riders only.

name: 50 to 01
description: Pro-level jump line. Huge gaps and mandatory air time. Competition grade features.

name: Blue Velvet
description: Beginner-friendly downhill at Antur. Flowing through forest. Good intro to gravity riding.

name: Cliffhanger
description: Technical red with slate features and exposure. Classic Antur terrain through quarry landscape.

name: Ewok Village
description: Flowing red through ancient woodland. Roots and natural features. Fun and fast.

name: Antur
description: Flagship black run. Steep, technical, and fast through dramatic slate landscape. Proper challenge.

name: The Wall
description: Epic valley-side trail with big climbs and technical descents. Raw, natural feel. Classic Welsh trail.

name: Blade
description: Modern addition to Afan. Flow-focused with optional jumps. Great fun on a hardtail.

name: Penhydd
description: Remote feeling trail through the valley. Natural terrain with technical sections.

name: White's Level
description: Most accessible Afan trail. Blue grade through beautiful valley scenery. Good for intermediates.

name: Twrch Trail
description: Classic Welsh red through Cwmcarn forest. Technical climbs and fast descents with valley views.

name: Cafall Trail
description: Longer Cwmcarn option. Natural terrain, remote feeling, proper day out.

name: Black Route
description: Llandegla's toughest. Technical features, north shore, and challenging terrain. Excellent drainage.

name: Red Route
description: Well-built red with great flow. Excellent drainage means it rides well year-round. Popular for good reason.

name: Blue Route
description: Perfect progression trail. Well-built with good flow. Family groups often ride together.

name: Gwydir Mawr (Marin Trail)
description: Proper mountain bike trail through Snowdonia. Big climbs on forest roads, all descents on sweetest singletrack. Tight technical to open flowing. Exposed ridgelines and dark forest.

name: Gwydir Bach
description: Shorter version of Marin Trail. 45-90 mins. Good introduction to natural Snowdonia riding.

name: Syfydrin
description: Technical red with stunning views. Red kites soaring overhead. Remote mid-Wales atmosphere.

name: Summit Trail
description: Serious day out. Big climbing, remote terrain, proper Welsh adventure. Pack food and spares.

name: Pendam
description: Accessible blue with great views. Good for families wanting something beyond green.
